vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
στῐγ-μα, ατος, τό,
tattoo-mark, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; σ. ἱρά, showing that the persons so marked were devoted to the service of the temple, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; especially of a slave, [NT+5th c.BC+]; ἀνωφελῆ σ., of inscribed laws, [Refs 1st c.AD+]
__2 generally, mark, spot, as on the dragon's skin, [Refs 8th c.BC+]
__3 stud, [LXX]
__4 σ. χρυσοῦν colour of gold, Ps.[Refs 5th c.BC+]
__5= cicatricis signum, [Refs]
vocabInfos.shortDef: mark, scar; in context Paul is likely referring to the scars he received in service to Jesus as marks of ownership by his master
